content:
/>
V.iii.5.1.e
.
Effective Dates and Liberalizing Changes Affecting SC for IHD
IHD became a condition presumptively associated with herbicide exposure effective August 31, 2010.  This was a liberalizing change of law.
Therefore, unless an earlier effective date is available under the provisions of
38 CFR 3.816
, consider the application of
38 CFR 3.114(a)
when granting presumptive SC for IHD related to herbicide exposure under the provisions of
38 CFR 3.307(a)(6)
and
38 CFR 3.309(e)
.
References
:  For more information on
the addition of presumptive conditions under the provisions of
38 CFR 3.309(e)
, see
M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart i, 1.B.1.i
the definition of IHD, see
M21-1, Part V, Subpart iii, 5.1.a
, and
M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart i, 2.B.1.c
, and
effective dates associated with liberalizing changes of law, see
M21-1, Part V, Subpart ii, 4.A.6
.
title: M21-1, Part V, Subpart iii, Chapter 5 - Cardiovascular System Conditions
citation: Part V, Subpart iii, Chapter 5, Section None
